intro: Engelhardia wallichiana var. chrysolepis, commonly known as the golden-leaved engelhardia, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves that contrast beautifully with its dark green stems. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is known for its aromatic foliage. It prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
